intro: Mitrophyllum cognatum, commonly known as the sweet pepper, is a herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other economically important plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into colorful, edible fruits. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branched. The fruit, which is typically red or yellow when mature, is rich in vitamins and antioxidants.
